类型: Color: Real Glass Green Polarized Lens
评论详情: The benefits of real glass lenses are many. They will not scratch! The coating inside may, mine have not scratched inside yet, but the outside will definitely not. You can even easily remove the MYWAY logo on the glass lens with a single edge razor blade. It's a painted on logo and since it is glass it comes off easily with no scratches on the lens. Just be sure the lens is clean and the razor blade is clean so no sand could possibly scratch the lens but most things won't because it is so hard. Much harder than a plastic sunglass lens! These are truly polarized too. The frames are solid. I'm not thrilled about the MYWAY logo on the sides but my black sharpie dulled down the bling.  The nose pieces are moulded in the frames which is perfect for me, nothing to come apart, nothing to lose.  I have owned my first pair for two years now. They do not age, but be aware that these will sink! Some plastic sunglasses float, or sink slowly, these sink. Perfect for driving, no distortion at all.
Really like these - sturdy comfortable and love the glass lenses

类型: Color: Real Glass Green Polarized Lens
评论详情: This is my second pair of Myway sunglasses. The quality and build is excellent. Yes, they are made in the same country as the majority of high end sunglasses. In fact “ 60 Minutes “ did a story on the company that now basically has a monopoly on the eyeglass and sunglass business. Over the years they have acquired Ray Ban and others…the company is Luxottica….and they are located in Italy. Chances are that if you have paid a lot of money for a high end brand of eyeglass frame or sunglasses….they were made or owned by Luxottica. I don’t know who owns Myway….what I do know is that Myway offers a product that is equal or better than any high end brand out there. I’m not talking about exotic metals such as gold or platinum that you would pay a fortune for….or diamonds attached…That is not a product that most can afford or would need. Real glass sunglasses are heavier than plastic and they are by far, more scratch resistant. In my opinion at this time, glass is superior to plastic optically. I especially like the polarized version. Very helpful in driving and any activity where glare can be a problem. By the way, I accidentally stepped on my first pair, they are not indestructible. I highly recommend this product….you don’t need to spend a ton of money on something just because it has a “ high end brand” on it.
